content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the GitHub Skill section and how many courses are under the 'First day on GitHub' heading.  Please interact with https://github.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to find the "GitHub Skill" section and look for a heading "First day on GitHub" to count the number of courses under it. These are likely under a training/resource category. The "Resources" menu (label 6) might contain such learning or skill-related content.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Learning Pathways" option (label 12) under the "Explore" section of the Resources menu seems most likely to lead to GitHub Skill sections and course listings. I should click on it to look for the "First day on GitHub" heading and its related courses.
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the "GitHub Learning Pathways" page, but there is a cookie notification at the bottom which might block part of the screen or navigation. To ensure clear access to all content, I should accept the cookies.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am on the "GitHub Learning Pathways" page. To find the GitHub Skill section and the "First day on GitHub" heading with its courses, I need to scroll down and view the content below the header.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page displays several learning "pathways", but neither the "GitHub Skill" section nor the "First day on GitHub" heading is visible yet. I need to scroll down further to look for the specific section and heading required by the task.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The pathways for Copilot, Automation, Security, and Administration are listed, but the "GitHub Skill" section and "First day on GitHub" heading still haven't appeared. There is a section starting with "Featuring expert insights from:" below, so continuing to scroll down is necessary.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view shows testimonial cards, but still no sign of the "GitHub Skill" section or "First day on GitHub" heading. I should continue scrolling down to reveal more of the page, as these sections may be farther below.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot still shows testimonials and some company logos below, but does not display the "GitHub Skill" section or the "First day on GitHub" heading. I need to scroll down further to continue searching for the required section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "GitHub Learning Pathways" heading and introductory text is now visible, indicating that relevant skill-based sections should appear further down. The "GitHub Skill" section and the "First day on GitHub" heading are likely below this point, so I need to keep scrolling.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The main content still consists of introductory text and headings, and the "GitHub Skill" section or the "First day on GitHub" heading still do not appear. I should continue scrolling down to get to the relevant course listings.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the end of the main content, scrolling into the footer. The "GitHub Skill" section and "First day on GitHub" heading with their course counts were not found on this page. Perhaps they are located within a subsection or require interaction with "Start your learning pathway" (label 8).
Action: Click [8]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows four pathways: "AI-powered development with GitHub Copilot", "CI/CD with GitHub Actions", "Shift left with GitHub Advanced Security", and "Administration and Governance with GitHub Enterprise". The "GitHub Skill" section and "First day on GitHub" heading are not visible yet. I should scroll down further, as introductory or beginner content is likely to be lower on the page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot now shows pathway links related to Copilot, Automation, Security, and Administration. However, there is still no "GitHub Skill" section or "First day on GitHub" heading with course counts. The "Featuring expert insights from:" section is visible, so it's clear the beginner/intro section was above this. It's possible the section I need is above and was missed during scrolling; I should scroll up.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The view has returned to the previously seen pathways for Copilot, Actions, Security, and Administration. Neither the "GitHub Skill" section nor the "First day on GitHub" heading appears here or just above. Since none of the observed areas contain the requested section, I should consider exploring another menu such as the "Learn" dropdown (label 4), which likely contains entry-level GitHub skills content.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Learn" dropdown is open, and "GitHub Learning Pathways," "Documentation," and "GitHub Certifications" are visible. To find the "GitHub Skill" section and "First day on GitHub" heading, the "GitHub Certifications" section (label 9) could contain skill-oriented and entry-level materials.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is showing the "GitHub Certifications" section with a banner message. There is a navigation bar at the top, and "Skills" (label 4) is likely where the GitHub Skill section and possibly the "First day on GitHub" heading can be found.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.93
